results.title: Alexandra's project
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia
results.brief_description: What strange and sometimes nasty things go on behind closed doors in suburbia is what this feature, written and directed by Rolf de Heer, is all about. An emotionally spent housewife Alexandra (Helen Buday) organises a birthday surprise for her husband and father of her two children. After enduring years of financial and emotional shutdown at the hands of her husband (Gary Sweet), Alexandra seeks revenge and sets about to undo her husband to the level at which she feels she has been wronged. Set for the most part within the four walls of the family home “Alexandra’s Project” is a tense, sexual and unsettling drama. Nominated for five Australian Film Institute Awards and three IF Awards. Contains sex scenes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia

results.title: Alexander Nevsky
results.creator_credit: D Vasiliev, Sergei Eisenstein and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Sergei Eisenstein’s patriotic masterpiece of the exploits of 13th Century Russian hero Prince Alexander Nevsky was his first sound film and featured a special musical score by composer Sergey Prokovief. The Prince, as chosen leader of the people of Novgorod, vanquished the Teutonic Knights on the ice of Lake Peipus. The characters, boldly drawn and unencumbered with psychological details, are monumental figures. All are conceived as they are imagined today and as they survive in folklore. The impressive cast includes Nikolai Cherkassov as Nevsky.

results.title: All about music
results.creator_credit: Fred Calvert, Farmhouse Films and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Provides, through the use of animation, an introduction to the origins and basic elements of music. Tells the story of a caveman and his discovery of rhythm, melody, and harmony. Highlights, with live action inserts, prehistoric contributions to the development of music, including modern music.

results.title: All about Eve
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Possibly one of the wittiest and sophisticated films ever made by Hollywood, “All About Eve” is a bitchy and sharp comedy about the jealousies and rivalries of theatrical life. Bette Davis, in one of her greatest performances, is Margo Channing, a self-obsessed, driven and committed actress who is shadowed and wooed by an aspiring starlet, Eve Harrington (Anne Baxter). However, the shy Eve is not as naive as she appears and by the end of the film she is moving to replace Margo and the poisonous cycle of ego and ambition is about to repeat itself. Wonderful adult dialogue, great direction and a cast of excellent supporting actors at their peak (George Sanders, Thelma Ritter, Celeste Holm) makes this movie one of the most entertaining ever produced. Watch out for Marilyn Monroe in an early cameo. Winner of six Academy Awards including Best Picture. Costumes by Edith Head. When they talk about the Golden Years of Hollywood this is one of the films to which they refer.

results.title: Aliens (Captioned) (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd, Brandywine Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Alien, the perfect organism. A killing machine whose physical excellence is matched only by its hostility. Officer Ellen Ripley and the crew of the starship Nostromo encountered such a creature and she alone survived the massacre. After floating in space for years Ripley is rescued only to learn that she must return to the planet where her nightmare began. L.V. 426, the world where Ripley first encountered the Alien is now colonised. When communication is lost with the settlers, a team of battle hardened space marines is sent with Ripley and find not one creature, but thousands. The Alien is breeding, and this time it’s all-out war! This special edition is a version of “Aliens” which contains 17 minutes of extra footage restored to the original by the director, James Cameron. Cast includes Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn and Paul Reiser.

results.title: Alien (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Walter Hill, David Gilger, Gordon Carroll and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A sci-fi thriller with a difference. The crew aboard the space freighter Nostromo investigate a distress call and one of the crew brings back on board an Alien of unknown origin. In comparison to the technology dominated sterile world controlled by a computer, where no-one trusts anyone, the horror of the Alien is its very organic nature. Under Scott’s direction this film is grippingly suspenseful and draws interesting parallels between the perfect inhumanity of the Alien and that of the company. Stars Sigourney Weaver, Dean Stanton and John Hurt.

results.title: Alien 3
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Walter Hill, David Giler, Gordon Carroll, Brandywine Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Continuing the “Alien” trilogy, Ripley’s spaceship crash lands into a maximum security work correctional facility, a monastic community, host to some of the most violent criminals in the universe -but she didn’t come alone. Once again Officer Ripley is pitted against her deadliest enemy, only this time without the aid of advanced technology or modern weapons. This video also contains a 26 minute documentary called “The Making of Alien Resurrection”, which is actually the next film in the “series” after “Alien 3”.

results.title: Alice, sweet Alice = Holy terror = Communion
results.brief_description: Alice is quite unlike other girls her age. Instead of playing with friends, she loses herself in a distorted secret world, populated by satanic rituals and occult masks. Alice is fiercely jealous of the favouritism her parents show towards her younger sister, Karen, a sibling jealousy that verges on demonic. When Alice’s sister and aunt are mysteriously murdered, Alice’s parents question the depths of their daughter’s evil intent. As the family self destructs, a priest and the police believe there are stronger forces involved and are intent on uncovering the unholy truth embodied in a seemingly normal Alice. Brooke Shields makes a brief, 10 minute appearance. Cast includes Linda Miller, Mildred Clinton, Paula Shepherd and Niles McMaster.

results.title: Alice Springs: red heart blue centre
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall, Department of the Northern Territory and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alice Springs is viewed here in its natural environment of desert landscape, ringed by distant ranges and Ayers Rock and as a busy township with its regular services, activities and recreations. From varied shots of its people and activities the camera frequently returns to the countryside around and shows close-up shots of its plant life. No spoken commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall, Department of the Northern Territory and Film Australia
